result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose I. Mata was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay restitution to V.H.M. 
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jose I. Mata in court, in custody, with attorney Ryan Drengler. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Ryan Wetzsteon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF384, 16CF144
10:31 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Court has received the Revocation Summary and Warrant packet. 
Atty Wetzsteon has received the packet and has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
No victims are present in the courtroom. 
Atty Drengler has received the packet and reviewed that with his client. 

Atty Wetzsteon makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Defendant makes statements to the court. 

BY THE COURT:  
16CF144 Count 4 -
Serve 150 days jail 

15CF384 -
Serve 150 days jail

Concurrent with one another and any other case he is currently serving. 
60 days credit.
Huber for employment and any counseling he may be involved in. 
Court does not allow that to be served on GPS Home Detention. 
Civil Judgments entered for the unpaid fine and costs of the case.
Electronic Filing Notice - not deliverable as addressed
filed by Atty Ryan Drengler
Sentencing Hearing on Revocation set for 09/07/18 - not deliverable as addressed
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 7, 2018 at 10:30 am.
Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations and Restitution /s/ TTF 06/29/18 - Probation extended until 07/12/20
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing

records.addlTxt: Disbursements Journal Final

Defendant Jose I. Mata in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-384 and 16CF-144.

3:54 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea today.

15CF-384: State has filed an amended information. 
Defendant will plead to amended charge.

16CF-144: Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 4.
Count 2 and Count 3 will be dismissed and read in

Defense is free to argue.

Atty McFarland concurs.
State has provided a victim impact statement in 15CF-384.

Atty McFarland has received a copy of the amended information and waives reading.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-384: Count 1 NO CONTEST
Defendant enters pleas of: 16CF-144: Count 1 and Count 4 NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney McFarland for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-384: Amended Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
16CF-144: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
16CF-144: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
16CF-144: Count 3: Dismissed and Read In
16CF-144: Count 4: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Defendant qualifies as a repeat offender.

Victims are not present.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-384:
Amended Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 Months
0 days jail credit
Conditions:
No contact with victim, VHM
Obtain and maintain full time employment
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent
Submit DNA Sample
Pay restitution in the amount of $150, shall be taken from the bond
Pay court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Complete a Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program if and when one becomes available

16CF-144: 
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 120 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for employment and counseling
All must be served in jail
0 days credit
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to 15CF-384
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 15CF-384
No contact with NH unless approved by Dept of Correction, then no violent or abusive contact
Pay court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 4:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 Months concurrent to Count 1 and 15CF-384
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 and 15CF-384
Pay court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Cash bond is to be applied to restitution/costs.
Court will allow early discharge after 18 months if the agent agrees and after all conditions of probation has been complied with

20 days in which to appeal
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
